## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor">SplitEditor</a> - Edit machine code and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals">LiveIntervals</a> for live range splitting.

<ul>
<li>Create a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor">SplitEditor</a> from a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/splitanalysis">SplitAnalysis</a>.</li>
<li>Start a new live interval with openIntv.</li>
<li>Mark the places where the new interval is entered using enterIntv&#42;</li>
<li>Mark the ranges where the new interval is used with useIntv&#42;</li>
<li>Mark the places where the interval is exited with exitIntv&#42;.</li>
<li>Finish the current interval with closeIntv and repeat from 2.</li>
<li>Rewrite instructions with <a href="#a98fa413da7a0053bf635119e74970219">finish()</a>.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line 263 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-h">SplitKit.h</a>.

## Enumerations

### enum  {#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::SplitEditor::ComplementSpillMode ">
<a href="#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7">ComplementSpillMode</a> - Select how the complement live range should be created.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7a5cd5c6b9f5402366a8e7a28a55925720" />
<EnumerationListItem name="SM_Partition">
<a href="#ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7a5cd5c6b9f5402366a8e7a28a55925720">SM&#95;Partition(Default)</a> - Try to create the complement interval so it doesn&#39;t overlap any other intervals, and the original interval is partitioned
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7ade36d2a249a7f767c968e8667190bc11" />
<EnumerationListItem name="SM_Size">
SM&#95;Size - Overlap intervals to minimize the number of inserted COPY instructions
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ad485b75a455867847a669a3f942cbcb7a7bfb05c8742572ff98fd4f226bb0aede" />
<EnumerationListItem name="SM_Speed">
SM&#95;Speed - Overlap intervals to minimize the expected execution frequency of the inserted copies
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/spliteditor">SplitEditor</a> automatically creates interval 0 to contain anything that isn&#39;t added to another interval. This complement interval can get quite complicated, and it can sometimes be an advantage to allow it to overlap the other intervals. If it is going to spill anyway, no registers are wasted by keeping a value in two places at the same time.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-h/#l00281">281</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-h">SplitKit.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### overlapIntv() {#a061a8d1b2719e16851521dddcd1a73cc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SplitEditor::overlapIntv (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> Start, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> End)</>}>
overlapIntv - Indicate that all instructions in range should use the open interval if End does not have tied-def usage of the register and in this case complement interval is used.

Let the complement interval be live.

This doubles the register pressure, but is sometimes required to deal with register uses after the last valid split point.

The Start index should be a return value from a leaveIntv&#42; call, and End should be in the same basic block. The parent interval must have the same value across the range.

### addDeadDef() {#ae4f8cecf24bb124e9cbb61c48a772053}

<MemberDefinition

Add a segment to the interval LI for the value number VNI.

If LI has subranges, corresponding segments will be added to them as well, but with newly created value numbers. If Original is true, dead def will only be added a subrange of LI if the corresponding subrange of the original interval has a def at this index. Otherwise, all subranges of LI will be updated.

### defValue() {#a02eceeafe7df8ca55a1b97241081894e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>VNInfo &#42; SplitEditor::defValue (unsigned RegIdx, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vninfo">VNInfo</a> &#42; ParentVNI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> Idx, bool Original)</>}>
defValue - define a value in RegIdx from ParentVNI at Idx.

Idx does not have to be ParentVNI-&gt;def, but it must be contained within ParentVNI&#39;s live range in ParentLI. The new value is added to the value map. The value being defined may either come from rematerialization (or an inserted copy), or it may be coming from the original interval. The parameter Original should be true in the latter case, otherwise it should be false. Return the new LI value.

### hoistCopies() {#a591700f4798fd0ce99310f3009760902}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void SplitEditor::hoistCopies ()">
Hoist back-copies to the complement interval.

For SM&#95;Size mode, find a common dominator for all the back-copies for the same ParentVNI and hoist the backcopies to the dominator BB.

It tries to hoist all the back-copies to one BB if it is beneficial, or else simply remove redundant backcopies dominated by others.

For SM&#95;Speed mode, if the common dominator is hot and it is not beneficial to do the hoisting, simply remove the dominated backcopies for the same ParentVNI.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-h/#l00404">404</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-h">SplitKit.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-cpp/#l01012">1012</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-cpp">SplitKit.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Values {#a5028b17a5a28f99ec554c098396c6bba}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="ValueMap llvm::SplitEditor::Values">
Values - keep track of the mapping from parent values to values in the new intervals.

Given a pair (RegIdx, ParentVNI-&gt;id), Values contains:


<ul>
<li>No entry - the value is not mapped to Edit.get(RegIdx).</li>
<li>(Null, false) - the value is mapped to multiple values in Edit.get(RegIdx). Each value is represented by a minimal live range at its def. The full live range can be inferred exactly from the range of RegIdx in RegAssign.</li>
<li>(Null, true). As above, but the ranges in RegAssign are too large, and the live range must be recomputed using ::extend().</li>
<li>(VNI, false) The value is mapped to a single new value. The new value has no live ranges anywhere.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-h/#l00339">339</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-h">SplitKit.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
